sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: NATO countries meet to discuss arms aid for Ukraine as nuclear threats cast a shadow over the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Eva Kiley, the former vice president of the European Parliament, charged in the corruption scandal shaking the institution, will stay in prison for at least another month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Ukraine is hoping NATO countries will follow Britain's lead in offering tanks to its army at a key meeting at NATO's Ramstein airbase in Germany today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Eleven countries have pledged more weapons, but Germany has so far resisted calls to send its leopards or to allow allies to send the German tanks to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We will continue to donate, continue to train and continue to stand by Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And it's not just NATO member states.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Sweden is sending arms including its Archer artillery system.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The key task of our state, of all of us and our partners, is to reinforce daily the feeling of the terrorist state Russia that they will not be able to achieve anything in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: A nuclear accident remains a real fear, with the International Atomic Energy Agency's boss Rafael Grossi in Kyiv to offer reassurance as inspectors are doing all they can to avoid it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: A nuclear strike by Russia is another matter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Former Russian President Dmitry Medvedev has posted a threatening message on his Telegram account.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The loss of a nuclear power in a conventional war, he says, can provoke the outbreak of a nuclear war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Russia continues its rhetoric of blaming others for the war and forging closer ties with Belarus.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It says to avoid the risk of aggression from the Western Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Eva Kaili, the former vice president of the European Parliament, charged in the

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: corruption scandal, will stay in prison on pretrial detention at least for one more month. The judge has announced the decision after a new hearing at the Court of Justice. A decision that is contested by her lawyers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The Federal Prosecutor's Office considers that all the risks that allow for continued detention exist.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The risk of absconding, the risk of collusion with third parties, the risk of destruction of evidence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: We believe that these risks do not exist.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: During the hearing, she looked exhausted.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: She entered the room wearing handcuffs that were taken out only during the process.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: After speaking for 10 minutes, she couldn't avoid crying when talking about her 23-months daughter who is now with Kaili's father.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: She asked to get her with her in or out of the prison.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: She insisted she is innocent and has nothing to do with the scandal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Her Greek lawyer has also said she was submitted to tortures last week while kept in detention for 16 hours by the federal police.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: What Mrs Kylie has experienced in the cell in the federal police station in Brussels is like it's from the medieval ages.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: She couldn't even sleep. This was forbidden.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: She was in the cold, they took her coat, she was left in the cold room and she was refused a second blanket.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: She wasn't even allowed to wash. All of this is torture.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This is what the European Convention of Human Rights says.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And this was what Mrs. Kaili asked me to tell you.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Highly concerned so that nobody goes through the same.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Her lawyers are also claiming that she's paying the highest price compared to other suspects that may be out and prepare their defense.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: They were referring to Pier Antonio Panseri, who made a deal with Belgian authorities and will start secret hearings on Tuesday to unveil substantial elements of the case and is expected to reveal more names of persons involved in the case, either as actors or as bribed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: At the same time, the request for the waiver of the immunity of two more MEPs, Mark Tarabella and Andrea Cozzolino, is underway.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The European Parliament have reassured the Belgian authorities that this will happen within the next month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: For the first time in 25 years, the European Parliament has voted to condemn Morocco.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The vote by MEPs in Strasbourg on Thursday calls on Rabat to respect media freedom in the country and to release all political prisoners and jailed journalists.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: All of this has only been possible because of the corruption scandal that's shaking the EU institution, which Morocco as well as Qatar is caught up in.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Both deny any wrongdoing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: For members of the left group in the European Parliament, it's unbelievable that under these circumstances, Morocco is still lobbying MEPs, even if this isn't illegal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We wanted to send a very clear, strong and united signal to Iran's regime that this really got out of hand and that we think they are behaving like terrorists by terrorizing their citizens and the whole region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The left has shown Euronews a letter from the Moroccan authorities which tries to convince its members not to vote to condemn the country and also to meet to discuss the matter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: However, Thursday's vote does not include the same measures applied to Qatar, after MEPs voted to suspend all work related to the country until there's more clarity on the investigation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: MEPs were also busy elsewhere, voting to list Iran's Revolutionary Guard as a terrorist organisation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The vote does not require member states to act, but puts pressure on them ahead of an EU foreign affairs minister's meeting next Monday, who are looking to tighten the screw on Tehran.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The country has been supplying drones to Russia for use against Ukraine, as well as violently putting down peaceful protests after the death of 22-year-old Massa Amini.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: MEPs also call on Tehran to stop the crackdown on their own people and condemn the execution of demonstrators.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We also wanted to send a very clear, strong and united signal to the Iranian regime that this really got out of hand and that we think they are actually behaving like terrorists, terrorizing their own citizens and the whole region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The vote also calls for sanctions against Iran's supreme leader Ali Khamenei and President Ibrahim Raisi.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Late Thursday afternoon and tens of thousands of French workers were still on the streets

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: protesting against President Macron's planned pension reforms.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Between a million and 2.5 million strikers took part, depending on who you believe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But what's not disputed is that those who did take part reject the idea of putting up the minimum retirement age from 62 to 64.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Today's mobilization reflects a massive opposition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: I think nearly 80% of the people are against it, especially among young people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: So today's mobilization reflects the opposition of the citizens of this country to this reform.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We have had to put things back on the table, and that means a different distribution of wealth.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: There are ways of financing public services and social protection, except Macron doesn't want to talk about it and that's the crux of the problem.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The strikes overshadowed Macron's visit to Barcelona for talks with the Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez when asked by journalists about his proposals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It's a reform that's been presented in a democratic way that's been validated, and that's a reform that's fair and responsible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The president defends his plans, pointing out that they were a pledge in his manifesto on which he was elected in 2017.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: There is then some support for them, but Thursday's widespread strike shows there's also considerable opposition from those who think the reforms are unfair.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan is the first senior U.S. official to visit Israel since Benjamin Netanyahu began governing in coalition with the far right.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The Israeli prime minister's partners are known for their racist anti-Arab rhetoric and for opposing the two-state solution advocated by Washington.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But that didn't stop Sullivan reaffirming U.S. support for Israel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I bring greetings from President Biden.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And as you know, his commitment to the state of Israel is bone deep.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And America's commitment to Israel is ironclad and it's a commitment that's rooted in shared history, shared interests and shared values.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The visit's taking place against the backdrop of Israeli-Palestinian skirmishes and the almost daily funerals of the victims of the clashes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: On Thursday, two Palestinians who were killed in an army raid were buried in the Jenin refugee camp.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: One of them was a teacher who was shot while trying to help a young man who had been wounded.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The conflict seems more entrenched than ever, something Arab-Israeli citizen Mahe Yunis knows first hand.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: He has returned to his hometown after spending 40 years in prison for killing a soldier.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Israel banned any celebrations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Hollywood actor Alec Baldwin will be charged with involuntary manslaughter over the shooting of a cinematographer two years ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Helena Hutchins was killed on a film set in New Mexico when Baldwin fired a prop gun.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: He was rehearsing a scene for the western film Rust.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The film's armorer, Hannah Guterres-Reed, will also be charged. Their lawyers say they intend to fight the accusations in court. Both Baldwin and Guterres-Reed face up to 18 months in jail and an almost 5,000 euro fine if convicted.
